topic: How to design stream processing using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to design stream processing using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Stream Processing using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides an overview of designing stream processing applications using FastAPI in Python 3.12+, including key points, code examples, version notes, and caveats.
key_points: FastAPI is a modern web framework for building APIs with Python 3.6+
Stream processing allows handling data streams instead of batches
In this guide, we will utilize ASGI (Async I/O Server Gateway Interface) to enable stream processing capabilities in FastAPI
We'll use Uvicorn as an ASGI server for FastAPI
This explainer focuses on Python 3.12+ and includes features like improved type hints, pattern matching, and more

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI
app = FastAPI()

@app.post('/stream')
asynchronous def process_data(data: bytes):
    # stream processing code here

version_notes: This guide utilizes Python 3.12 features like improved type hints, pattern matching, and more.
Uvicorn recommends using version 0.15.0 or higher
caveats: Stream processing can be resource-intensive, so be mindful of memory and CPU usage
This explainer is a high-level overview and does not cover all the intricacies of designing stream processing applications using FastAPI
For production use, consider error handling, logging, and monitoring
